message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the construction and analysis of codes that correct errors caused by duplications in a sequence of symbols. This problem is related to information theory (cs.IT), as it involves encoding and decoding information. The paper also discusses the redundancy of the codes, which is a topic in coding theory (cs.CC). The analysis of the code size upper bounds involves sphere packing arguments, which is a technique used in discrete mathematics and theoretical computer science (cs.DS, cs.DC). Finally, the paper compares the redundancy of the proposed constructions with the redundancy of existing codes that correct arbitrary burst insertions, which is a topic in signal processing and communication (cs.SI).
